Dispute_Type: Dispute over dealership terminations and alleged price maintenance practices
Legal_Issue: Whether the limitation provisions in s. 36(4)(a)(i) of the Competition Act bar claims under s. 61(1)(a) and (b)
Procedural_Stage: Motion for dismissal based on limitation periods
Evidence_Assessment: Plaintiffs' evidence suggests ongoing conduct but no clear threat or discrimination after May 28, 1991; The Palings rule applied to parts sales until termination, within the limitation period
Decision_Outcome: Motion allowed in part: claims under s. 61(1)(a) and truck-related claims under s. 61(1)(b) dismissed
Legal_Rule: Under s. 36(4)(a)(i), actions must be brought within two years from the conduct or final criminal proceedings, whichever is later
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged price maintenance practices and dealership termination
Outcome_on_Merits: Claims under s. 61(1)(a) are barred; parts-related claims under s. 61(1)(b) are not dismissed
Key_Evidence_Considered: Ongoing conduct by plaintiffs; timing of dealership termination; application of Palings rule to parts sales
Applicant_Challenge: Defending against dismissal based on limitation period
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory interpretation of the Competition Act
Defendant_Response: Motion for dismissal based on limitation period
Evidence_Type: Documentary and factual evidence of conduct and termination dates
Remedy_Requested: Dismissal of claims based on limitation period
Outcome: Claims under s. 61(1)(a) and truck-related s. 61(1)(b) claims dismissed; parts claims survive
Resolution_Mechanism: Motion hearing with judicial determination on limitation issue
Legal_Provision: s. 36(4)(a)(i), s. 61(1)(a), s. 61(1)(b) of the Competition Act
